doc.repnme: Issues related to higher education in Sub-Saharan Africa
doc.abstracts: This paper examines the higher education sector in Sub-Saharan African countries. It begins by describing the growth and structure of the sector, the amount of resources used the original rational for its development. This is followed by analyses of the labor markets faced by higher education graduates using a wide range of data including rates of return, wage structures and trends, recorded vacancies, levels of expatriate employment and government employment policies. From these, labor market assessments are constructed for fifteen countries.
